facts.fact: Upgrading your lightbulbs to more efficient LEDs can save 0.1 tonnes of CO2e per year.
Turn your water heater down to 120˚F. This can save about 550 pounds of CO2 a year.
Take shorter showers and fix leaking fixtures in your bathroom. The average person wastes up to 30 gallons of water every day without even realizing it.
Take care of your car. Keeping your tires properly inflated can increase your fuel efficiency by three percent; and ensuring that your car is properly maintained can increase it by four percent.

Rethink disposable packaging and products. Single-use plastic is not only a major source of water pollution and a huge source of what’s sent to landfill but it’s also accompanied by a big carbon footprint.
Use a reusable water bottle. By avoiding single-use plastic bottles, you can significantly reduce your carbon footprint and help decrease plastic pollution.
Doing two loads of laundry weekly in cold water instead of hot or warm water can save up to 500 pounds of carbon dioxide each year.
